alert.note: Alert for Knox; Lincoln (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 4:24AM EST until December 12 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc and Waldo. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin. * WHEN...Until noon EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Rain was steady overnight with most areas receiving between 1 and 1.5 inches. As of 4 AM, the rain in combination with snowmelt had started to overwhelm storm drainage systems. Low-water crossings were becoming inundated with water and soon will be impassable. The runoff will reach small streams which will rise steadily through the day, with the potential to come out of their banks. Flood prone streams should be closely monitored. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 AM EST, Steady rain combined with snowmelt has produced excessive runoff this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area, extending the flooding into the afternoon. Additional flood warnings are possible later today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lewiston, Auburn, Brunswick, Augusta, Waterville, Bath, Rockland, Belfast, Fairfield and Gardiner.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
